### encrypt_asymmetric { #imitation_game.encrypt_asymmetric.encrypt_asymmetric }

```python
encrypt_asymmetric.encrypt_asymmetric(
    message,
    receiver_public_key,
    sender_private_key,
)
```

Encrypts a message using the receiver's public key and signs it with the sender's private key.
This ensures both confidentiality (only receiver can decrypt) and authenticity (receiver can verify sender).

#### Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name                | Type         | Description                                                                               | Default    |
|---------------------|--------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------|
| message             | str          | The plaintext message to encrypt.                                                         | _required_ |
| receiver_public_key | bytes or str | The receiver's RSA public key in PEM format (bytes) or path to key file (str).            | _required_ |
| sender_private_key  | bytes or str | The sender's RSA private key in PEM format (bytes) or path to key file (str) for signing. | _required_ |

#### Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type   | Description                                                     |
|--------|--------|-----------------------------------------------------------------|
|        | str    | Base64-encoded JSON containing encrypted message and signature. |

#### Raises {.doc-section .doc-section-raises}

| Name   | Type       | Description                                                        |
|--------|------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------|
|        | ValueError | If the message is too long for RSA encryption or keys are invalid. |
